TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit Utf8JsonReader extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: Provides a high-performance API for forward-only, read-only access to UTF-8 encoded JSON text.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
`Utf8JsonReader` processes the text sequentially with no caching and by default adheres strictly to the [JSON RFC](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8259).
When `Utf8JsonReader` encounters invalid JSON, it throws a <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonException> with basic error information like line number and byte position on the line.
Since this type is a ref struct, it doesn't directly support async. However, it does provide support for reentrancy to read incomplete data and to continue reading once more data is presented.
To be able to set max depth while reading OR allow skipping comments, create an instance of <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderState> and pass it to the reader.

MemberSignature.Value: public Utf8JsonReader (System.Buffers.ReadOnlySequence<byte> jsonData, System.Text.Json.JsonReaderOptions options = null);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Buffers.ReadOnlySequence`1<unsigned int8> jsonData, valuetype System.Text.Json.JsonReaderOptions options) cil managed
Public Sub New (jsonData As ReadOnlySequence(Of Byte), Optional options As JsonReaderOptions = null)

Docs.param: The UTF-8 encoded JSON text to process.

An object that defines customized behavior of the that differs from the JSON RFC (for example how to handle comments or maximum depth allowed when reading). By default, the follows the JSON RFC strictly; comments within the JSON are invalid, and the maximum depth is 64.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the structure that processes a read-only sequence of UTF-8 encoded text using the specified options.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Since this type is a ref struct, it is a stack-only type, and all the limitations of ref structs apply to it.
This constructor assumes that the entire JSON payload is contained in `jsonData`; it is equivalent to <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.IsFinalBlock?displayProperty=nameWithType> = `true`.

Public Sub New (jsonData As ReadOnlySpan(Of Byte), Optional options As JsonReaderOptions = null)

Docs.param: The UTF-8 encoded JSON text to process.

An object that defines customized behavior of the that differs from the JSON RFC (for example how to handle comments or maximum depth allowed when reading). By default, the follows the JSON RFC strictly; comments within the JSON are invalid, and the maximum depth is 64.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the structure that processes a read-only span of UTF-8 encoded text using the specified options.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Since this type is a ref struct, it is a stack-only type, and all the limitations of ref structs apply to it.
This constructor assumes that the entire JSON payload is contained in `jsonData`; it is equivalent to <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.IsFinalBlock?displayProperty=nameWithType> = `true`.

Docs.param: The UTF-8 encoded JSON text to process.
if the input sequence contains the entire data to process; only the input span contains partial data with more data to follow.
An object that contains the reader state. If this is the first call to the constructor, pass in a default state. Otherwise, capture the state from the previous instance of the and pass that back.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the structure that processes a read-only sequence of UTF-8 encoded text and indicates whether the input contains all the text to process.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Since this type is a ref struct, it is a stack-only type, and all the limitations of ref structs apply to it. This is the reason why the constructor accepts a <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderState>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CurrentDepth As Integer
public: property int CurrentDepth { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the depth of the current token.
Docs.value: The depth of the current token.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The `CurrentDepth` property tracks the recursive depth of the nested objects or arrays within the JSON text processed so far.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CurrentState As JsonReaderState
public: property System::Text::Json::JsonReaderState CurrentState { System::Text::Json::JsonReaderState get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the current state to pass to a constructor with more data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Unlike the <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader>, which is a ref struct, the state can survive across async/await boundaries. This type is required to provide support for reading in more data asynchronously before continuing with a new instance of the <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property HasValueSequence As Boolean
public: property bool HasValueSequence { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates which Value property to use to get the token value.
Docs.value: if should be used to get the token value; if should be used instead.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If `HasValueSequence` is `false`, <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.ValueSequence> is empty. Therefore, read the token value using the <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.ValueSpan> property.
For input data within a `ReadOnlySpan<byte>`, this always returns `false`. For input data within a `ReadOnlySequence<byte>`, this only returns `true` if the token value straddles more than a single segment and hence can't be represented as a span.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsFinalBlock As Boolean
public: property bool IsFinalBlock { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the mode of this instance of the which indicates whether all the JSON data was provided or there is more data to come.
Docs.value: if the reader was constructed with the input span or sequence containing the entire JSON data to process; if the reader was constructed with an input span or sequence that may contain partial JSON data with more data to follow.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Position As SequencePosition
public: property SequencePosition Position { SequencePosition get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the current within the provided UTF-8 encoded input ReadOnlySequence<byte> or a default if the struct was constructed with a ReadOnlySpan<byte>.
Docs.value: The current within the provided UTF-8 encoded input ReadOnlySequence<byte> or a default if the struct was constructed with a ReadOnlySpan<byte>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Read() cil managed

Docs.summary: Reads the next JSON token from the input source.
Docs.returns: if the token was read successfully; otherwise, .
Docs.exception:
An invalid JSON token according to the JSON RFC is encountered.
-or-
The current depth exceeds the recursive limit set by the maximum depth.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Skip() cil managed

Docs.summary: Skips the children of the current JSON token.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
When <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.TokenType> is <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonTokenType.PropertyName?displayProperty=nameWithType>, the reader first moves to the property value.
When <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.TokenType> (originally, or after advancing) is <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonTokenType.StartObject?displayProperty=nameWithtype> or <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonTokenType.StartArray?displayProperty=nameWithType>, the reader advances to the matching <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonTokenType.EndObject?displayProperty=nameWithType> or <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonTokenType.EndArray?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
For all other token types, the reader does not move. After the next call to <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.Read>, the reader will be at the next value (when in an array), the next property name (when in an object), or the end array/object token.

Docs.exception: The reader was given partial data with more data to follow (that is, is ).

An invalid JSON token was encountered while skipping, according to the JSON RFC.
-or-
The current depth exceeds the recursive limit set by the maximum depth.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TokenStartIndex As Long
public: property long TokenStartIndex { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the index that the last processed JSON token starts at (within the given UTF-8 encoded input text), skipping any white space.
Docs.value: The starting index of the last processed JSON token within the given UTF-8 encoded input text.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
For JSON strings (including property names), this value points to before the start quote.
For comments, this value points to before the first comment delimiter (that is, '/').

Docs.summary: Gets the type of the last processed JSON token in the UTF-8 encoded JSON text.
Docs.value: The type of the last processed JSON token.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool TrySkip() cil managed

Docs.summary: Tries to skip the children of the current JSON token.
Docs.returns: if there was enough data for the children to be skipped successfully; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If the reader did not have enough data to completely skip the children of the current token, it will be reset to the state it was in before the method was called.
When <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.TokenType> is <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonTokenType.PropertyName?displayProperty=nameWithType>, the reader first moves to the property value.
When <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.TokenType> (originally, or after advancing) is <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonTokenType.StartObject?displayProperty=nameWithType> or <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonTokenType.StartArray?displayProperty=nameWithType>, the reader advances to the matching <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonTokenType.EndObject?displayProperty=nameWithType> or <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonTokenType.EndArray?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
For all other token types, the reader does not move. After the next call to <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.Read>, the reader will be at the next value (when in an array), the next property name (when in an object), or the end array/object token.

Docs.exception:
An invalid JSON token was encountered while skipping, according to the JSON RFC.
-or -
The current depth exceeds the recursive limit set by the maximum depth.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ValueSequence As ReadOnlySequence(Of Byte)

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the last processed token as a slice of the input payload. If the JSON is provided within a and the slice that represents the token value fits in a single segment, then contains the sliced value since it can be represented as a span. Otherwise, contains the token value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.HasValueSequence> is `false`, `ValueSequence` is empty. Therefore, only access `ValueSequence` if <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.HasValueSequence> is `true`. Otherwise, the token value must be accessed from <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.ValueSpan>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ValueSpan As ReadOnlySpan(Of Byte)
public: property ReadOnlySpan<System::Byte> ValueSpan { ReadOnlySpan<System::Byte> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the last processed token as a ReadOnlySpan<byte> slice of the input payload. If the JSON is provided within a ReadOnlySequence<byte> and the slice that represents the token value fits in a single segment, then contains the sliced value since it can be represented as a span. Otherwise, the contains the token value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.HasValueSequence> is `true`, <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.ValueSpan> is empty. Therefore, only access `ValueSpan` if <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.HasValueSequence> is `false`. Otherwise, the token value must be accessed from <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.ValueSequence>.

Docs.summary: Compares the specified text to the unescaped JSON token value in the source and returns a value that indicates whether they match.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If the look-up text is invalid UTF-8 text, the method returns `false` since you can't have invalid UTF-8 within the JSON payload.
The comparison of the JSON token value in the source and the lookup text is done by first unescaping the JSON value in source, if required. The look-up text is matched as is, without any modification.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ValueTextEquals(valuetype System.ReadOnlySpan`1<unsigned int8> utf8Text) cil managed
Public Function ValueTextEquals (utf8Text As ReadOnlySpan(Of Byte)) As Boolean

Docs.param: The UTF-8 encoded text to compare against.
Docs.summary: Compares the UTF-8 encoded text in a read-only byte span to the unescaped JSON token value in the source and returns a value that indicates whether they match.
Docs.returns: if the JSON token value in the source matches the UTF-8 encoded lookup text; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If the lookup text is invalid UTF-8 text, the method returns `false` since you can't have invalid UTF-8 within the JSON payload.
The comparison of the JSON token value in the source and the lookup text is done by first unescaping the JSON value in source, if required. The lookup text is matched as is, without any modifications to it.

Docs.exception: The JSON token that is not a string (that is, it is not or ).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ValueTextEquals(valuetype System.ReadOnlySpan`1<char> text) cil managed
Public Function ValueTextEquals (text As ReadOnlySpan(Of Char)) As Boolean

Docs.param: The UTF-8 encoded text to compare against.
Docs.summary: Compares the UTF-8 encoded text in a read-only character span to the unescaped JSON token value in the source and returns a value that indicates whether they match.
Docs.returns: if the JSON token value in the source matches the UTF-8 encoded lookup text; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If the lookup text is invalid or incomplete UTF-16 text (that is, unpaired surrogates), the method returns `false` since you can't have invalid UTF-16 within the JSON payload.
The comparison of the JSON token value in the source and the lookup text is done by first unescaping the JSON value in source, if required. The lookup text is matched as is, without any modifications to it.

Docs.exception: The JSON token that is not a string (that is, it is not or ).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ValueTextEquals(string text) cil managed
Public Function ValueTextEquals (text As String) As Boolean

Docs.param: The text to compare against.
Docs.summary: Compares the text in a character span to the unescaped JSON token value in the source and returns a value that indicates whether they match.
Docs.returns: if the JSON token value in the source matches the lookup text; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If the lookup text is invalid UTF-8 text, the method returns `false` since you can't have invalid UTF-8 within the JSON payload.
The comparison of the JSON token value in the source and the lookup text is done by first unescaping the JSON value in source, if required. The lookup text is matched as is, without any modifications to it.

Docs.exception: The JSON token that is not a string (that is, it is not or ).
